body:
Hello @TomAugspurger! Thanks for submitting the PR.

 - There are no PEP8 issues in the file [`pandas/core/base.py`](https://github.com/TomAugspurger/pandas/blob/39710e4b68f1ba91bd64e8cb7edc6dfcd14b5095/pandas/core/base.py) !

 - There are no PEP8 issues in the file [`pandas/core/indexes/datetimes.py`](https://github.com/TomAugspurger/pandas/blob/39710e4b68f1ba91bd64e8cb7edc6dfcd14b5095/pandas/core/indexes/datetimes.py) !

 - There are no PEP8 issues in the file [`pandas/core/internals/blocks.py`](https://github.com/TomAugspurger/pandas/blob/39710e4b68f1ba91bd64e8cb7edc6dfcd14b5095/pandas/core/internals/blocks.py) !

 - There are no PEP8 issues in the file [`pandas/core/internals/managers.py`](https://github.com/TomAugspurger/pandas/blob/39710e4b68f1ba91bd64e8cb7edc6dfcd14b5095/pandas/core/internals/managers.py) !

 - There are no PEP8 issues in the file [`pandas/core/reshape/reshape.py`](https://github.com/TomAugspurger/pandas/blob/39710e4b68f1ba91bd64e8cb7edc6dfcd14b5095/pandas/core/reshape/reshape.py) !

 - There are no PEP8 issues in the file [`pandas/tests/extension/base/reshaping.py`](https://github.com/TomAugspurger/pandas/blob/39710e4b68f1ba91bd64e8cb7edc6dfcd14b5095/pandas/tests/extension/base/reshaping.py) !

 - There are no PEP8 issues in the file [`pandas/util/testing.py`](https://github.com/TomAugspurger/pandas/blob/39710e4b68f1ba91bd64e8cb7edc6dfcd14b5095/pandas/util/testing.py) !

> Powered by [Codecov](https://codecov.io/gh/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/24163?src=pr&el=footer). Last update [c911151...7c22e92](https://codecov.io/gh/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/24163?src=pr&el=lastupdated). Read the [comment docs](https://docs.codecov.io/docs/pull-request-comments).

Only failure was the Azure lining, which has since been fixed on master.

@jorisvandenbossche IIRC, you preferred that `Series[period].values` would return an ndarray of objects right?

>  you preferred that Series[period].values would return an ndarray of objects right?

That might be :-) In any case, since then we added `array`, so I think the rationale to keep `.values` backward compatible makes sense.
